Package timer.timer

Interface Timer

All Known Implementing Classes:
CleverRandomListingGeneratorTimer, SimpleRandomListingGeneratorTimer
public interface Timer
We are interested in how long our implemented methods take to execute. This interface defines a time method that can be used to time a given method in implementing classes. This is known as the timed method. Each timer.Timer object is expected to have some int measure of the "size" of the task the timed method has to undertake.
Version:
September 2019
Author:
Hugh Osborne

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    long getMaximumRuntime()
    A timer.Timer object should specify the maximum length of time that a time test should run
    int getMaximumTaskSize()
    timer.Timer objects must also specify the maximum task size that they wish to see timed.
    int getMinimumTaskSize()
    timer.Timer objects must also specify the minimum task size that they wish to see timed.
    Timer getTimer​(int size)
    Get a timer.Timer object with a task of the given size for the timed method.
    default java.time.Duration time()
    Run the timed method belonging to an implementing class, and time how long it takes.
    void timedMethod()
    Nominate the timed method.
    default void timingSequence()
    Run a sequence of time tests of increasing size.

  • Method Details

    • getTimer

      Timer getTimer​(int size)
      Get a timer.Timer object with a task of the given size for the timed method.
      Parameters:
      size - the size of the task to be timed.
      Returns:
      a timer.Timer object with a task of that size

    • timedMethod

      void timedMethod()
      Nominate the timed method. In an implementing class timedMethod will be a wrapper method for the method to be timed.

    • getMaximumRuntime

      long getMaximumRuntime()
      A timer.Timer object should specify the maximum length of time that a time test should run
      Returns:
      the maximum time that a single time test should run, in seconds

    • getMinimumTaskSize

      int getMinimumTaskSize()
      timer.Timer objects must also specify the minimum task size that they wish to see timed.
      Returns:
      the maximum task size to be timed

    • getMaximumTaskSize

      int getMaximumTaskSize()
      timer.Timer objects must also specify the maximum task size that they wish to see timed.
      Returns:
      the maximum task size to be timed

    • time

      default java.time.Duration time()
      Run the timed method belonging to an implementing class, and time how long it takes.
      Returns:
      the time taken to execute the method being timed, in nanoseconds

    • timingSequence

      default void timingSequence()
      Run a sequence of time tests of increasing size. Task sizes of size 1,2,..,9, then 10,20,..,90 and so on for increasing powers of ten are timed. The sequence of tests terminates when the execution time of the randomisation reaches or surpasses the time limit, or the size of the generator reaches or surpasses the maximum size.
